title: Time Travel to Brazil, 1750
description: The year is 1750 in Brazil, during the height of the colonial period. This era is marked by the exploitation of natural resources and the beginning of extensive agriculture. Your decisions will impact the environment and influence the future of air quality in this region. Choose your actions wisely:

choices.text: Implement sustainable methods in sugar cane plantations to reduce slash-and-burn practices.
choices.consequence: Adopting these methods decreases deforestation and soil degradation, leading to lower smoke emissions and contributing to a healthier atmosphere.

choices.text: Encourage the use of wood from native forests for shipbuilding and export.
choices.consequence: This choice boosts the economy but leads to extensive deforestation, reducing air quality and increasing carbon emissions significantly.

choices.text: Promote the extraction of gold using mercury amalgamation.
choices.consequence: While lucrative, this method releases toxic mercury vapors into the atmosphere, poisoning air and water, and harming both human health and wildlife.

choices.text: Advocate for the establishment of protected natural reserves to conserve biodiversity.
choices.consequence: Creating reserves helps preserve large areas of forest, enhancing air quality through carbon sequestration and safeguarding diverse ecosystems for future generations.
